headline: Wall Street’s Macro Traders Eye Their Biggest Haul in 16 Years
summary: Firms including Goldman Sachs Group Inc., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citigroup Inc. are expected to generate $165 billion in revenue from trading in fixed-income, credit and commodities this year, up 10% on 2024, according to data from Crisil Coalition Greenwich.  In the Group-of-10 rates business, revenue is expected to reach a five-year high of $40 billion.  Coalition Greenwich is anticipating a similar windfall in 2026, when the industry’s revenue is expected to be just 2% less at $162 billion.
